intro: Ardisia dumicola, commonly known as the rock ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries such as Thailand, Vietnam, and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries that appear in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or limestone areas, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Ardisia dumicola is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal fruiting.
